EssayText: For us it is usually a set, get, and displayMessge or other messages that tell you what properties a class has but does not reveal its implementations. You could have anything you want in your own class definition.
The attributes of said class. Also whether or not it is a subclass. Also whether it is public private or protected.

either data or function declarations, and optionally access specifiers.  Example for specifiers would be public, private, and protected.  There is the keyword Class and the Class body is enclosed with brackets ({}).
